title: Organizational Systems-Based Instructional Design Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational instructional design theories and subject-matter expertise in science
context.additional_context: Learners are ordinary citizens with advanced science domain expertise, participating in asynchronous learning via LMS in BYOD environments

learning_goals: Learners cultivate the ability to assess systemic-level impacts in instructional design by analyzing organizational systemic interactions.
Learners systematically execute a design process—from learner needs analysis to solution prototype development—using design thinking methodologies.

Learners can apply the five-stage HPT (Human Performance Technology) strategy (performance analysis, cause analysis, intervention design, implementation, evaluation) to propose three instructional design solutions for improving organizational performance in public/nonprofit educational institutions and explain their expected effects using quantitative metrics (e.g., 15% work efficiency improvement, 20% training completion rate increase).
Learners develop a sustainable performance improvement framework by integrating systems theory into science education solutions.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
